intro: Urostachys funiformis, commonly known as the long-stemmed spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and often showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a low shrub with erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are usually alternate and lance-shaped, with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Urostachys funiformis is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
